Legal_Issue: Was there an administrative error under subsection 66(4) denying CPP benefits?
Governing_Law: Canada Pension Plan and Old Age Security Act, subsection 66(4)
Evidence_Assessment: Department failed to verify 1973 contributions; T4 likely in system but not searched until 2003
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate entitlement and administrative error
Legal_Rule: If erroneous advice or administrative error denies a benefit, Minister must take remedial action
Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly search contribution records
Grounds_for_Claim: Denial of CPP benefits due to unverified 1973 contributions
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Administrative failure to verify correct records
Key_Evidence_Considered: 1973 T4 slip, contribution records, application history
Legal_Framework: Canada Pension Plan, administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of CPP benefits in 1977 due to administrative error
Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 66(4) of the Canada Pension Plan and Old Age Security Act
Outcome: Remanded to the Minister for reconsideration
Decision_Authority: Minister of Employment and Social Development
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 66(4) of the Canada Pension Plan and Old Age Security Act
Governing_Rule: Subsection 66(4) â€“ Remedial action for administrative error
